artist: John Tyson; Northern Electric Company (now Nortel Networks)
creditline: Lent by Richard and Diana Rose
description: brown; rotary-dial; hand-set is L shaped, as is wall unit and cradle; hand-set attached to wall unit with brown spiral cord
dimension: 9 1/8 x 5 1/2 x 3 1/4 in. (23.18 x 13.97 x 8.26 cm) (with hand-set in cradle)
text: Canada's Northern Electric Company produced a variety of modernist phone casings such as the "Contempra" wall phone.  Combining practical and economical with a dash of artistic flair, particularly intense colors, was common to their sleek designs.  A series of round or spherical phones ("Genie," "Dawn," and "Pancake" models) in the 1980s were a popular alternative to the familiar box-like forms.
title: "Contempra" touch-tone wall phone
